verses.kjv: When thou goest out to battle against thine enemies, and seest horses, and chariots, and a people more than thou, be not afraid of them: for the LORD thy God is with thee, which brought thee up out of the land of Egypt.
verses.ct: When you go out to war against your enemies and see horses, chariots, and an army larger than yours, don't be afraid of them. The LORD your God is with you — the same God who brought you out of Egypt.

verses.kjv: And it shall be, when ye are come nigh unto the battle, that the priest shall approach and speak unto the people,
verses.ct: When you are about to go into battle, the priest will come forward and address the troops.

verses.kjv: And shall say unto them, Hear, O Israel, ye approach this day unto battle against your enemies: let not your hearts faint, fear not, and do not tremble, neither be ye terrified because of them;
verses.ct: He will say to them, 'Listen, Israel! Today you are going into battle against your enemies. Don't lose courage. Don't be afraid, don't panic, and don't be terrified of them.

verses.kjv: For the LORD your God is he that goeth with you, to fight for you against your enemies, to save you.
verses.ct: The LORD your God is the one going with you. He will fight for you against your enemies and rescue you.'

verses.kjv: And the officers shall speak unto the people, saying, What man is there that hath built a new house, and hath not dedicated it? let him go and return to his house, lest he die in the battle, and another man dedicate it.
verses.ct: Then the officers will address the troops, saying, 'Has anyone here built a new house but not yet moved into it? He should leave and go back home, so that if he dies in battle, someone else won't be the one to move in.'

verses.kjv: And what man is he that hath planted a vineyard, and hath not yet eaten of it? let him also go and return unto his house, lest he die in the battle, and another man eat of it.
verses.ct: 'Has anyone planted a vineyard but not yet enjoyed its fruit? He should leave and go back home, so that if he dies in battle, someone else won't be the one to enjoy it.'

verses.kjv: And what man is there that hath betrothed a wife, and hath not taken her? let him go and return unto his house, lest he die in the battle, and another man take her.
verses.ct: 'Has anyone become engaged to a woman but not yet married her? He should leave and go back home, so that if he dies in battle, someone else won't marry her.'

verses.kjv: And the officers shall speak further unto the people, and they shall say, What man is there that is fearful and fainthearted? let him go and return unto his house, lest his brethren’s heart faint as well as his heart.
verses.ct: The officers will also say, 'Is anyone here afraid or losing heart? He should leave and go back home, so he doesn't cause his brothers to lose heart too.'

verses.kjv: And it shall be, when the officers have made an end of speaking unto the people, that they shall make captains of the armies to lead the people.
verses.ct: After the officers have finished speaking to the troops, they will appoint commanders over the army units to lead the people.

verses.kjv: When thou comest nigh unto a city to fight against it, then proclaim peace unto it.
verses.ct: When you approach a city to attack it, first offer it terms of peace.

verses.kjv: And it shall be, if it make thee answer of peace, and open unto thee, then it shall be, that all the people that is found therein shall be tributaries unto thee, and they shall serve thee.
verses.ct: If the city accepts your peace offer and opens its gates to you, then all the people living there will become your forced laborers and will serve you.

verses.kjv: And if it will make no peace with thee, but will make war against thee, then thou shalt besiege it:
verses.ct: But if the city refuses to make peace and chooses to fight against you, then lay siege to it.

verses.kjv: And when the LORD thy God hath delivered it into thine hands, thou shalt smite every male thereof with the edge of the sword:
verses.ct: When the LORD your God gives you victory over it, you must kill every male in it with the sword.

verses.kjv: But the women, and the little ones, and the cattle, and all that is in the city, even all the spoil thereof, shalt thou take unto thyself; and thou shalt eat the spoil of thine enemies, which the LORD thy God hath given thee.
verses.ct: However, you may take the women, children, livestock, and everything else in the city as plunder for yourselves. You may use the plunder from your enemies that the LORD your God has given you.

verses.kjv: Thus shalt thou do unto all the cities which are very far off from thee, which are not of the cities of these nations.
verses.ct: This is how you are to deal with all the cities that are far away from you — cities that don't belong to these nearby nations.

verses.kjv: But of the cities of these people, which the LORD thy God doth give thee for an inheritance, thou shalt save alive nothing that breatheth:
verses.ct: But in the cities of these peoples that the LORD your God is giving you as an inheritance, you must not leave anything alive that breathes.

verses.kjv: But thou shalt utterly destroy them; namely, the Hittites, and the Amorites, the Canaanites, and the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites; as the LORD thy God hath commanded thee:
verses.ct: You must completely destroy them — the Hittites, the Amorites, the Canaanites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites — just as the LORD your God has commanded you.

verses.kjv: That they teach you not to do after all their abominations, which they have done unto their gods; so should ye sin against the LORD your God.
verses.ct: This is so they won't teach you to imitate all the disgusting practices they perform for their gods, which would cause you to sin against the LORD your God.

verses.kjv: When thou shalt besiege a city a long time, in making war against it to take it, thou shalt not destroy the trees thereof by forcing an axe against them: for thou mayest eat of them, and thou shalt not cut them down (for the tree of the field is man’s life) to employ them in the siege:
verses.ct: When you lay siege to a city for a long time while fighting to capture it, you must not destroy its trees by taking an axe to them. You can eat their fruit, so don't cut them down. A tree in the field is not your enemy to be used in the siege.

verses.kjv: Only the trees which thou knowest that they be not trees for meat, thou shalt destroy and cut them down; and thou shalt build bulwarks against the city that maketh war with thee, until it be subdued.
verses.ct: However, trees that you know don't produce food — those you may cut down and destroy. Use them to build siege works against the city that is fighting you, until it falls.
